capsules_submitted.utterance: So Harry is 11 years old. I'm pretty sure about that, and I think it's a fact that can be confirmed.

capsules_submitted.utterance: So I've been told that Harry has a gray mouse as one of his belongings. That's definitely true, and I'm quite certain about it. It sounds like a pretty ordinary item to have around, but I guess you never know what someone might be holding onto.

capsules_submitted.utterance: I think Professor McGonagall is a fantastic role model in the Harry Potter series. She's an amazing witch and a great teacher at Hogwarts. I really admire her strength and courage, especially when it comes to standing up for what's right.
capsules_submitted.reply: if you don't mind me asking. what kind of character is valeria?

capsules_submitted.utterance: So I've been doing some research on Hermione Granger's family background and it turns out she has a pretty interesting mix of magical heritage. Her parents, Mr. and Mrs. Granger, are both Muggle-born wizards, but they have a bit of a complicated history when it comes to their own family lineage. Apparently, her father's side is quite proud of its wizarding roots, while her mother's side has a more... let's say, 'unconventional' connection to the magical world.

I've always been fascinated by the magical heritage of my family, and I have to admit that Hermione's lineage is quite impressive. As a mixed-wizard myself, I can relate to the complexities of having a wizarding parent and a non-magical one, but Hermione seems to have navigated it all with ease.
capsules_submitted.reply: i would like to know. what kind of character is valeria?
